intro: Leptocarpus setuligerus, commonly known as the slender-leaved sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils near the coast, often growing in dunes or on rocky outcrops. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
